column4: seahorse - GNOME front end for GnuPG i don't think seahorse is keyring related
lsb_release -a from terminal is one way
you can see "/msg ubottu version" i believe for that same direction
does "lsusb" show the device for starters?
hmm.. one entry i dont know what it is "Atheros Communications, Inc". The others dont look like wlan devices.
atheros is probably your wlan - does it show a model number?  if so, i'd search online for support for that particular model.
no, it just shows the string i typed. but i have the package. its a tl-wn721n.
for general wireless you could check the "/msg ubottu atheros" factoid, just a general wireless help wiki page a believe, not atheros specific!
hmm.. maybe i install the latest ubuntu version and see if it supports it out of the box?
but how do i know it doesnt support it already?
well, 10.04 ISN'T going to have the best hardward support at this time... so that "could" work, but 0 guarantee.
you'll have to search online, or is someone here happens to have the same hardware (perhaps they'll know more).  best of luck.
i mean, maybe my machine supports this stick, but i have to enable wlan somewhere?
do you have a networking icon in top right corner?  check in that (it's Network Manager btw)
no. i dont have a top panel.
